params.lendingTime: time for how long permission will persist expressed in days
params.price: Amount of ETH (in Wei), for which license for this tokenId can be bought

params.owner: Address for whom to query the balance

params.upkeepNeeded: returns true or false depending on 4 conditions

params.borrower: Address, which has rights to use specific piece of art described in certificate
Address, which has rights to use specific piece of art described in certificate
Address, which has rights to use specific piece of art described in certificate

params.owner: Address for whom to check the ownership

returns._0: True if `owner` has a valid token, false otherwise
holdersCount Number of token unique holders
True if the token is valid, false otherwise

mintNFT(string).details: This function in future can be restricted with minting price to provide some profits for DRM protocol creators.

params.createdTokenURI: URI to assign for minted certificate

returns._0: Descriptive name of the tokens in this contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

revokeCertificate(uint256).details: This function in future can be restricted by voting and used only if major of users vote that specific certificate is plagiarism

returns._0: An abbreviated name of the tokens in this contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

Minted(address,uint256).notice: Event emitted when a token `tokenId` is minted for `owner`

Revoked(address,uint256).notice: Event emitted when token `tokenId` of `owner` is revoked

allowLending(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Allows owner of tokenId(Certificate) to make this token borrowable by other users

balanceOf(address).notice: Count all tokens assigned to an owner

blockLending(uint256).notice: Allows owner of tokenId(Certificate) to make this token unborrowable

buyLicense(uint256,address).notice: Gives permission to borrower to use copyrights assigned to specific certificate marked by tokenId

checkUpkeep(bytes).notice: This is the function that the Chainlink Keeper nodes call to check if performing upkeep is needed

getCertsBorrowers(uint256).notice: Returns all active borrowers of specific certificate(tokenId)

getClause(uint256,address).notice: Returns clause for certain tokenId and borrower

getExpirationTime(uint256,address).notice: Tells if given certificate(tokenId) is allowed to be borrowed by other users

getLendingStatus(uint256).notice: Tells if given certificate(tokenId) is allowed to be borrowed by other users

getLicenseValidity(uint256,address).notice: Tells if given borrower is allowed to use given certificate(tokenId)

getProceeds(address).notice: Gives amount of ETH available to withdraw by certificate lender

hasValid(address).notice: Check if an address owns a valid token in the contract

isValid(uint256).notice: Check if a token hasn't been revoked

performUpkeep(bytes).notice: Once checkUpkeep() returns "true" this function is called to execute licenseStatusUpdater() functionIt iterates thru all tokenId's and borrowers per those tokens to remove all licenses that have expired

revokeCertificate(uint256).notice: Allows contract owner to revoke token with copyrights plagiarism

tokenURI(uint256).notice: URI to query to get the certificate's metadata

withdrawProceeds().notice: Allows lenders to withdraw their proceeds
